quiz.text: With respect to regulation of the medical institutes in the country, which of the following statement is correct?
options: Medical Assessment and Rating Board (MARB) under the National Medical Commission (NMC) Act, 2019 constituted for assessing and rating of medical institutions for their compliance with NMC standards.
As per Indian Medical Council (Professional Conduct, Etiquette and Ethics) Regulations 2002, issued under Indian Medical Council Act 1956, complaints related to medical negligence are handled.

The National Council for Clinical Establishments under Clinical Establishments (Registration and Regulation) Act, 2010 (CE Act, 2010) for registration and regulation of Government (except those of Armed Forces) as well as private clinical establishments.
The complaints related to deficiency in medical services can also be filed in District/State/National Consumer Dispute Redressal Forums under the Consumer Protection Act 1986 (Amended 2019).
All of the above.

quiz.text: Recently ‘Indian Council of Medical Research-India Diabetes (ICMR INDIAB)’ study has been published, which was carried out to quantify the prevalence of metabolic Non-Communicable Diseases (NCDs) in India. Which of the following NCD has highest proportion in India?
options: Diabetes
Hypertension
Generalized obesity
Dyslipidemia
None of the above.

quiz.text: SVASTIK or ‘Scientifically Validated Societal Traditional Knowledge’ initiative seen in the news recently, identify the incorrect statement with respect to it?
options: CSIR-National Institute of Science Communication and Policy Research (CSIR-NIScPR) has been assigned as the nodal organisation to implement this national initiative.

SVASTIK's objective is to conserve the practice of the right tradition, inculcate scientific temper of verifying tradition in a scientific manner and instil confidence in citizens regarding the scientific value of our traditional knowledge/practices.
It is a Prime Minister Office (PMO) monitored initiative.
None of the above.
All of the above.

quiz.text: National Programme for Control of Blindness and Visual Impairment (NPCBVI) seen in the news recently, identify incorrect statement with respect to it.
options: NPCBVI was launched in the year 1976 as a 100% Centrally Sponsored scheme.

Under NPCBVI, a Mission Mode Cataract Surgery campaign (Netra Jyoti Abhiyan) was launched (2022-2025) to clear backlog of eligible cataract cases by allotting yearly targets to each State and Union UT.
For the FY-2022-23, a target of 75,00,000 cataract surgery was kept against which 83,44,824 cataract surgeries were done.
This drive is a major step taken to reduce the prevalence of avoidable blindness to 25% by 2025.
All of the above

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), the Roundtable conference was organized ahead of upcoming India Health Dialogue Summit (IHD), which is to be held in November. Identify correct statement with respect to India Health Dialogue (IHD).A) India Health Dialogue (IHD) platform was launched in New Delhi on 3rd May 2023.B) It is a global initiative of India Chamber of Business and Commerce in partnership with Indian Council of Medical research (ICMR), Indian Medical Association (IMA) and supported by Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.C) It is a global initiative of India Chamber of Business and Commerce in partnership with Indian Council of Medical research (ICMR), Indian Medical Association (IMA) and supported by Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises.
options: Only A
Only B
Only B and C
Only A and B
Only A and C

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), ________ signed MOU with _______ to share expertise and resources, as well as co-develop quality learning resources in Indian Sign Language on the occasion of 3rd year of NEP 2020 celebrations and 2nd Akhil Bharatiya Shiksha Sangam.
options: Indian Sign Language Research and Training Centre (ISLRTC), The National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS)
Indian Sign Language Research and Training Centre (ISLRTC), The Indira Gandhi National Open University (IGNOU)
Indian Sign Language Research and Training Centre (ISLRTC), The University Grants Commission (UGC)
Indian Sign Language Research and Training Centre (ISLRTC), The National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)
Indian Sign Language Research and Training Centre (ISLRTC), The All-India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023) Consultative Committee Meeting of Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change was held on ‘75@75 Ramsar Sites’. With respect to India’s wetland conservation efforts, identify the correct statements.A) The network of Indian Ramsar Sites covering approx. 1.33 million ha, over 8% of the known wetland extent of the country is the second largest in Asia. B) The network of Indian Ramsar Sites ranks fifth in the world in terms of total number of designated Ramsar Sites.C) The network of Indian Ramsar Sites ranks first in the world in terms of total area of designated Ramsar Sites.
options: A only
B only
A and C only
A and B only
All of the above.

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), Union Minister for Power and New & Renewable Energy informed about the Revised Biomass Policy, the new targets set under this policy are-
options: 5 % biomass co-firing in Thermal Power Plants (TPPs) from FY 2024-25, shall increase to 7% from FY 2025-26.
5 % biomass co-firing in Thermal Power Plants (TPPs) from FY 2024-25, shall increase to 10% from FY 2025-26.
10 % biomass co-firing in Thermal Power Plants (TPPs) from FY 2024-25, shall increase to 15% from FY 2025-26.
15 % biomass co-firing in Thermal Power Plants (TPPs) from FY 2024-25, shall increase to 20% from FY 2025-26.
20 % biomass co-firing in Thermal Power Plants (TPPs) from FY 2024-25, shall increase to 25% from FY 2025-26.

quiz.text: Prior environmental clearance shall be required for projects/activities located within the default Eco-Sensitive Zones (ECZ), meaning zone within ________ of the boundaries of the protected areas including National Parks and Sanctuaries. Environmental Clearance (EC) granted by the MoEF&CC in the default Eco-Sensitive Zones (ESZs) as per the provisions of the _______.
options: 5 km, Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) Notification, 2006.
1 km, Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) Notification, 2006.
15 km, Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) Notification, 2006.
10 km, Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) Notification, 2006.
None of the above.

quiz.text: Union cabinet has recently approved he City Investments to Innovate, Integrate and Sustain 2.0 (CITIIS 2.0).  CITIIS 2.0 is a program conceived by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA) in partnership with the French Development Agency (AFD), Kreditanstalt für Wiederaufbau (KfW), ________, and National Institute of Urban Affairs (NIUA). The program will run from 2023 till ________.
options: World Bank, 2025
World Bank, 2027
European Union, 2025
European Union, 2027
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following initiatives contribute towards inclusion of the transgender community?
options: The Transgender Persons (Protection of Rights) Act 2019
The National Education Policy (NEP), 2020
National Initiative for School Heads’ and Teachers’ Holistic Advancement (NISHTHA)
Samagra Shiksha
All of the above.

quiz.text: With the aim to transform the functioning of Panchayati Raj Institutions, number of e-Governance initiatives have been undertaken at the grassroot level. Which of the following is/are the correct one?A) eGramSwaraj: Encompasses various modules pertaining to Panchayat functioning such as planning, accounting, monitoring, asset management and provides digitized account books.B) AuditOnline: Open-source application that facilitates the online financial audit of accounts at exclusively at the Gram Panchayat level.C) BharatNet project is being implemented to create network to connect all the Gram Panchayat by broadband in the country.
options: A and B only
A and C only
B and C only
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), ________ has notified the creation of a new category of _________ for foreign nationals for treatment under Indian systems of medicine.
options: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Ayush (AY) visa
Ministry of Home Affairs, Ayush (AY) visa
Ministry of Home Affairs, Aarogya Visa
Ministry of Civil Aviation, Aarogya Visa
Ministry of Civil Aviation, Ayush (AY) visa

quiz.text:
Recently (August 2023), the Jan Vishwas (Amendment of Provisions) Bill, 2023 was passed in Lok Sabha during the monsoon session. Which of the following changes are proposed in the bill?

A) Pragmatic revision of fines and penalties, where it seeks to remove imprisonment clauses and/or fines in some provisions and convert them into penalties in some others.

B) Establishment of Adjudicating Officers and of Appellate Authorities.

C) Periodic increase in quantum of fine and penalties every three years, with an increase of 20% of the minimum amount for various offences in the specified Acts.
options: A and B only
A and C only
B and C only
A, B and C
All of the above

quiz.text: The Parliament has recently (August 2023) passed the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Amendment Bill, 2023. Which of the following provision is not part of it?
options: After the first three years, the licence will be allowed to retain up to 25% of the originally authorised area.
The Bill allows the private sector to mine 12 atomic minerals.
The exploration licence will be granted by the state government through competitive bidding.
The Bill allows activities under a single exploration licence in an area up to 1,000 square kilometres.
None of the above

quiz.text: Prime Minister of India, Shri Narendra Modi, recently (August 2023) announced the 'Meri Maati Mera Desh' campaign during his Mann Ki Baat broadcast. Identify correct statement with respect to it-
options: It is rolled out under Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav and it will be the concluding programme of Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav.
Mitti ka Naman and Veeron ka Vandan are the key components of this campaign.
Har Ghar Tiranga will be celebrated between 13th -15th August, 2023 under it.
Aims to honour the brave freedom fighters and bravehearts who sacrificed their lives for the country.
All of the above.

quiz.text: The Rajya Sabha recently (August 2023) passed the Offshore Areas Mineral (Development and Regulation) Amendment Bill, 2023 which seeks to make amendments to the OAMDR Act, 2002. Which of the following is the salient feature of the Amendment Bill?
options: Operating rights in the mineral bearing areas are reserved to Public Sector Undertakings (PSUs) by the Central Government.
Provision has been introduced to permit renewal of licence.
Limit has been removed on total area one person can acquire in the offshore.
None of the above
All of the above

quiz.text: With total participation of over 300 participants (263 domestic participants and 70 international delegates) including the international delegates from 13 G20 and 4 guest countries and 8 International Organisations, the G20 EMPOWER Summit recently (August 2023) took place in __________.
options: New Delhi
Mumbai
Gandhinagar
Chennai
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), the exhibition titled ‘India@75: Contribution of Women’ organized by-
options: Ministry of Women and Child Development in partnership with the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII).
Ministry of Women and Child Development in partnership with the UN Women's Office in India and Confederation of Indian Industry (CII).
Ministry of Women and Child Development in partnership with the UN Women's Office in India.
Ministry of Women and Child Development in partnership with the Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry.
Ministry of Women and Child Development only.

quiz.text: Under National Rail Plan, Indian Railways has started “Mission Hungry for Cargo” targeting _______ modal share in freight transportation from the current 27 per cent.
options: 35%
45%
50%
55%

₹ 2,01,113 crore

quiz.text: 100 GCT will be developed under the PM Gati Shakti master plan. Up to 30th June, 2023, a total of _______ Gati Shakti Multi-Modal Cargo Terminal (GCT) have been commissioned across the country, which include 05 GCTs (i.e. at Patratu, Sindri, Godda, Pakur and Thaparnagar) in Jharkhand.

85

75

quiz.text: Providing PNG connections are part of the development of City Gas Distribution (CGD) Network. Minimum Work Programme (MWP) targets of PNG connections are provided by the Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board (PNGRB). As per MWP target, approx. _______ PNG connections to be provided by 2030 in rural and urban areas.

30.5 crore
25.5 crore

quiz.text: India's current Strategic Petroleum Reserves (SPRs) Infrastructure is having combined capacity of 5.33 million metric tonnes (MMT) of crude oil. These storage sites are strategically positioned across two states. Which of the following site is not one of them?

Mangalore, Karnataka
Padur, Karnataka

quiz.text: 22nd Law Commission was constituted for three-year period with effect from 21st February, 2020. The tenure of present 22nd Law Commission of India was supposed to end on 20th February, 2023 but with extension of tenure, it will now end on _______.

21st February, 2025.
21st February, 2024.
31st August 2025.

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is/are incorrect with respect to National Research Foundation (NFR)?a) The Administrative Department of NRF is Department of Biotechnology.b) The Principal Scientific Advisor the Government of India is the ex-officio President of the Governing Board of NRFC) The Prime Minister of India is the Chair of the Executive Council of NRF
